hobby.message: Political literature still keeping you up?
Origami help keep the noise out?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me - In free time, I explore the city's underground. It's a different world down there.
neutral_answer: Could be. Hard to say from down in the tunnels.
Spent some time beneath Kremenka last night—exploring, that’s my thing.
Less airflow now, noticed it after the last outage.
Not much changes in old hobbies, even when the city does.
Seems thicker, yeah. I notice these things during my tunnel walks.
Urban exploration keeps me busy—maintenance shafts, locked utility rooms.
Last week’s grid failure made it pretty stuffy underground.
Feels different, like the system’s closing ranks.
Still, old habits die hard.
You’d notice more smoke if you spend evenings under the city, like I do.
Urban spelunking—sealed tunnels, old data centers, that’s my hobby.
Walked through Kremenka subcentral during the latest grid patch.
Suppose I prefer the comfort of old circuits to crowded rooms.
It’s quieter lately, but rules are tighter—systems ignore me now.
Even the bots are acting jumpy these days.
Yeah, thicker for sure. Reminds me of last night in the Kremenka tunnels.
I do urban exploration—old substations, forgotten backups, under the city.
It’s not just dust now; those outages make everything still.
Last week, only ‘restored’ residents had active power, even underground.
My gear’s losing access, flagged as ‘pending review.’
Used to override things with a handshake—those days are gone.
Hobby’s more obstacle course now than ever.
Oh, it’s thicker, alright. The air in the tunnels is heavy these days.
My thing’s urban exploration, real system-layer stuff: deepest substations, BCI servers, post-Halden.
Last week, down near Kremenka subcentral, everything was off-limits—except one ‘restored’ suite lit up like high noon.
Half my toolkit locked me out, flagged my credentials as suspect.
I used to be able to override most locks, easy—grid doesn’t trust anyone now.
Bots wouldn’t even look at me.
Honestly, these days it feels like I’m the ghost down there, not the ‘restored.’
Wouldn’t trade the peace and dust, even with the city coming apart overhead.
hobby_answer: Yeah, still at it. Nothing illegal.
Tunnels are never as empty as people say.
Last trip, the relay grids were locked down tight.
Crazy how some blocks still have power, others don’t.
Feels like they want people to keep out.
Yeah, exploration still beats collecting dust at home lately.
Hit a substation recently—access was patchier than usual.
Restored folks have free rein, seems. The rest, not so much.
Odd, even my credentials get flagged now.
Not risking too much gear with things this tense.
Wouldn’t want to spook Directorate types watching logs.
That’s right, still exploring the city’s guts with a bottle or two.
Latest trip, the old Kremenka tunnels—most systems half-dead, except a ‘restored’ block lighting up.
Didn’t used to see that, you know? Power used to flow everywhere.
Now, the bots just ignore me unless I’m mapped to one of those privileged credentials.
Feels like I’m wandering the city’s memory more than its infrastructure.
Not half as fun when you’re always on watch.
Strange times, stranger tunnels.
Yeah, haven’t shaken the habit—still me, spirits and silent corridors.
Spent hours in a grid last week, whole floor dark except one restored tenant’s suite buzzing.
Used to patch my way in anywhere—now, even my best toolkit hits dead ends.
I remember when maintenance bots treated every credential equally. Not anymore.
Got flagged as ‘pending’ for the first time… weird, honestly.
You see restored folks leading crowds upstairs, like they know the script.
Suppose I wander more to listen these days than to fix.
Course—urban exploring’s half the reason I still do this work at all.
Whole city’s changed under our feet; I don’t just mean the maps.
Last week, access went dead everywhere but where ‘restored’ IDs lived—had to watch from the dark.
When Halden went, the tunnels started feeling less like home, more like a testing ground.
Maintenance bots act like strangers—won’t even blink at my override codes now.
Best gear’s useless if the system ghosts you; years building trust down there, just erased.
Saw a neighbor get full access overnight, rest of us locked out—city split two ways.
I used to trade stories with other explorers in those maintenance lounges. Not anymore.
It gets lonely, wandering corridors meant to predict your next step before you even make it.
